author: Artem Kamenskyi
title: Religion and Philosophy and the Problem of Evil Free Essay Example
text: 24/7 writing help on your phone Save to my list Remove from my list A mass shooting in California shocked the country last week, a little girl received a cancer diagnoses today, and over 100 people will die from suicide in the United States tomorrow. This is the cycle of a never ending thing called evil. Countless theologians and scholars have battled with this issue from the very beginning. ‚ÄúWhy do bad things happen to good people?‚Äù is the question that individuals face every day. To the atheist, evil is possibly their best evidence against God. Why would a good God let all of this happen to His creation? Charles Baudelaire said, ‚ÄúIf there is a God, he must be the Devil.‚Äù With a bit of critical thinking and the help of St. Augustine, Christians can better explain this problem of evil to both the unbeliever and the believer alike. This paper will argue that St. Augustine‚Äôs solution on the existence, power and goodness of God, despite the evil in the world, outweighs the solutions of other philosophers. The existence of evil is a non-believer‚Äôs best weapon against the idea of God. Atheists usually try to find flaws in the theist‚Äôs position instead of having any tangible evidence against God themselves, but this has one big exception. According to Ed Miller and Jon Jensen, evil is ‚Äúthe most notorious evidence against God.‚Äù For years Augustine struggled with the topic himself and even postponed his conversion to Christianity for quite some time. If Augustine had to seriously consider converting to Christianity, then it is imperative that one knows how to argue against the atheists so they too may one day see the truth in God. It is also important that believers themselves realize the truth behind the evil. Structurally, this paper will first discuss the problem of evil and the claims that coincide with it will be stated. After that, some of the philosophers that argue against a loving, powerful God because of evil will be brought up with their solutions. Next, St. Augustine will come in and his views on evil will be explained. Finally, the paper will evaluate why Augustine‚Äôs view is a sufficient view for the existence and goodness of God with the wickedness in the world and give a conclusion of the topic. Before this term of evil is discussed, it is important to recognize what exactly evil is. There are two main types. Miller defines natural evil as ‚Äúthe evil that results from natural causes,‚Äù and it includes disease, starvation, physical deformities, and numerous other ‚Äúsources of underserved anguish.‚Äù The other type is moral evil, which is ‚Äúthe evil that results from personal depravity.‚Äù This includes the terrible acts such as murder, theft, war, and other man-created evils. Both of these terms are included in the problem of evil. So what then is this problem of evil? The problem is called ‚Äútheodicy,‚Äù or the justification of God; it is God on trial. David Hume, a philosopher especially known for his skepticism and naturalism views, states the problem in a simple way: ‚ÄúIs he willing to prevent evil, but not able? then is he impotent. Is he able, but not willing? then is he malevolent. Is he both able and willing? whence then is evil?‚Äù This well-known statement can be narrowed down to three controversial claims: 1. God is omnipotent. 2. God is omnibenevolent. 3. There is evil in the world. With these claims, philosophers everywhere have tried to find solutions to this problem. One of the most popular solutions today is to recognize that we do not know God‚Äôs plan. It is far beyond our knowledge. Stephen Davis, in his book Encountering Evil, says the following: ‚ÄúGiven what is said about God‚Äôs transcendence and our cognitive limits, we would expect that there will be evils that we cannot explain‚Ä¶‚Äù Even in the Bible it is said that we cannot fully understand God‚Äôs ways. ‚ÄúFor my thoughts are not your thoughts, nor are your ways my ways, says the LORD.‚Äù Alas, while this solution would be satisfying from a religious standpoint, this is more of a philosophical issue for the sake of this paper. Leaning away from the faith side and heading towards reason, Gottfried Leibniz comes to another solution. Often identified with his work in his book Theodicy, Leibniz proposed that it is impossible for a perfect world to exist: ‚ÄúI do not believe that a world without evil, preferable in order to ours, is possible; otherwise it would have been preferred.‚Äù He suggests that all of the evil is ultimately for a greater good. Miller explains, ‚ÄúAnything created by God would have to be less than God just by virtue of being dependent on him, and this means immediately that it must be less than perfect.‚Äù If we were too perfect to need a God, there would have been no point to create us. One notable philosopher with a rather radical solution to the issue is the very influential John Stuart Mill. In his Three Essays on Religion, Mill lays out why there is evil in the world. He explains that God is not all-powerful, but does have a threshold to His power. If God were all-powerful, wouldn‚Äôt he have the ability to get rid of evil? Mill goes on to say, ‚Äú[Christianity] represents [the Creator] as for some inscrutable reason tolerating the perpetual counteraction of his purposes by the will of another Being of opposite character‚Ä¶ the Devil.‚Äù This statement not only downplays the Christian God‚Äôs omnipotence and omnibenevolence but also suggests that the Devil is to blame for evil. These are only a few of the claims made about the solution to evil. There is a whole other set of solutions that do not include a God at all, but for the sake of time, this paper will move on to the great Augustine‚Äôs theories of evil. After the authors of the New Testament, St. Augustine of the third century has probably been the most influential writer in the world. Before he became a great Christian philosopher and theologian, Augustine succumbed to the life of parties and sin. After he began to devote himself to Christ, he also devoted his life to thinking critically about his Creator‚Äôs world. Therefore, St. Augustine‚Äôs theories of the problem of evil came about. Although it has a long tradition, the privation theory of evil is mostly associated with Augustine. This theory states that evil is nothing more than the absence or privation of goodness, and God only creates things that are good. Augustine writes, ‚ÄúFor the Almighty God, who, as even the heathen acknowledge, has supreme power over all things, being Himself supremely good, would never permit the existence of anything evil among his works.... For what is that which we call evil but the absence of good?‚Äù To put evil as a picture, it is like a rust. ‚ÄúRottenness and rust do not exist in themselves but only something else as the corruption of it.‚Äù God cannot create something that is nothing; He, the absolute good, is responsible for the goodness of the world, not the nonbeing and evil. This theory allows St. Augustine to argue that God is still all-powerful, all-knowing, and all-loving in the face of evil. A point to be made is that God made human beings to be good, not perfect. ‚ÄúGod saw all that he had made, and it was good‚Ä¶‚Äù Humans are inherently good, yet they are not perfect and are therefore open to corruption--open to rusting and dissolving God‚Äôs creation. It is also important to state that although Augustine denies evil as a substance, he more than most recognizes that it is very real. So then, where did this evil come from? This is where Augustine‚Äôs Free-Will Defense comes in. In this defense, Augustine writes in his book On Free Choice of Will about how our sin is voluntary: ‚ÄúYet since this defect is voluntary, it lies within our power.‚Äù With this free will, one can take the three statements from the skeptics‚Äô problem of evil and add one more statement to it: 1. God is omnipotent. 2. God is omnibenevolent. 3. God desires free rational agents. 4. Suffering exists. The third statement allows for a lot more flexibility with this issue. In order for God to be all-loving while being all-powerful, he wanted to make beings that could make real decisions instead of Him being a master puppeteer. With this free will, humans have the ability to do what they want with the world--good or bad. Augustine describes the cause of our evil as having disordered loves. We are creatures with desires, and God intended these desires to be in a certain order-- God first, others second, ourselves third, and things last. Augustine confessed to disordering these loves himself in his Confessions by saying, ‚ÄúBecause my will was perverse it changed to lust, and lust yielded to become habit, and habit not resisted became necessity.‚Äù When we put anything before God, we are subject to sin. God is the only unmovable thing in the universe! Therefore, one cannot blame the Devil for the evil in this world; it is humans who are to blame. How do we get rid of evil? We have to get rid of ourselves, but obviously God is not quite ready for that. The other philosophers bring up some interesting suggestions, but all of them ultimately fail because they do not have the adequate explanations for the problem of evil. St. Augustine explains that evil and suffering can take place in the world, even with a loving and powerful God. God is not the cause of suffering, and it was never His intention for evil to take place in the world. However, evil is present because of the fact that God made the world to be good, not perfect and because God gave us the right to free will. Evil is not a thing or being, but is actually the ‚ÄúPrivation of Good‚Äù as St. Augustine tells us. When we think of evil as an absence of good, it makes sense that there will be instances of the corruption of good in this imperfect world. The presence of evil in the world is one of the biggest problems Christianity faces. Christians and non-Christians both ask, ‚ÄúHow can all this evil and suffering take place if God is who He says He is? He knows what is happening, and He loves us, and He is powerful enough to make it stop.‚Äù As non-Christians, it may be easy to ignore that God is all of those things, but as Christians, we must accept that God is powerful, knowing, and loving. Therefore, when people come to us with these questions, we must be able to defend God in the face of evil with a well-formulated response. St. Augustine lays out this response and gives us a solution that we can validly argue. This solution still allows God to be omnipotent and omnibenevolent and explains how evil can come about in light of all this. The works of St. Augustine are trustworthy because the presences of evil was a topic that bothered him for much of his life. He spent many years trying to work out a solution that would allow him to believe in God even with the existence of evil; many would say he did exceptionally well in bringing the situation to light in the 4th century, 2015, and every year in between. üëã Hi! I‚Äôm your smart assistant Amy! Don‚Äôt know where to start? Type your requirements and I‚Äôll connect you to an academic expert within 3 minutes.

Premier League explicar√° a√ß√µes do VAR nas redes sociais durante jogos. As imagens do torcedor alvinegro fazendo gestos racistas em dire√ß√£o √† torcida do Palmeiras foram publicadas pelo jornalista Tossiro Neto no Instagram, na noite de quarta (14), durante o jogo. A identifica√ß√£o dele foi poss√≠vel, segundo apura√ß√£o da Ag√™ncia Brasil, ap√≥s o Botafogo analisar as imagens e tamb√©m o sistema de biometria usado na entrada do p√∫blico no Nilton Santos. Todas as informa√ß√µes colhidas pelo Botafogo foram encaminhadas √† Pol√≠cia Civil do Rio de Janeiro para abertura de inqu√©rito.
O diretor-executivo do Botafogo, Thairo Arruda, repostou a nota do Botafogo no X (antigo Twitter), mencionando a La Liga (entidade que organiza o Campeonato Espanhol).

author: BBC News Mundo
title: Israel sigue su ofensiva en Gaza mientras parece no tener a√∫n un plan claro a medio plazo
text:
EFE Latam Israel sigue su ofensiva en Gaza mientras parece no tener a√∫n un plan claro a medio plazo Leer todo el art√≠culo Agencia EFE 29 de diciembre de 2023, 12:33 a. m. ¬∑ 4 min de lectura
Jerusal√©n, 28 dic (EFE).- El Ej√©rcito israel√≠ sigui√≥ este jueves con su ofensiva en Gaza, donde contin√∫an los duros combates con Ham√°s y aumentan los muertos, en un contexto en que Israel asume que sus operaciones ir√°n por largo y debe comenzar a planear un escenario a medio plazo.
Mientras Ham√°s va difundiendo videos donde se ve a sus milicias haciendo emboscadas y atacando tropas y tanques israel√≠es, el Ej√©rcito contin√∫a realizando operaciones en el norte, centro y sur de la Franja, entre ellas en la urbe meridional de Jan Yunis, donde las fuerzas israel√≠es "llevan a cabo misiones sin precedentes", dijo este jueves el ministro de Defensa israel√≠, Yoav Gallant.
"Nuestras fuerzas llegan a zonas en las que nunca antes hab√≠amos estado, tomando salas de control y eliminando a terroristas", a√±adi√≥ Gallant, durante una visita en el cuartel general de la Divisi√≥n 98, cuerpo militar que combate ahora en el √°rea de Jan Yunis.
A su vez, las tropas intensifican su incursi√≥n militar en el √°rea sur de la Franja, operaci√≥n que iniciaron semanas atr√°s, centr√°ndose tambi√©n ah√≠ en alcanzar "los centros de mando, dep√≥sitos de armas e instalaciones de producci√≥n" de armamento de las milicias.
Todo ello, reiter√≥ Gallant, con "la tarea de desmantelar a Ham√°s para que ya no tenga capacidad militar ni de Gobierno", fin para el que las fuerzas israel√≠es deber√°n demostrar "mucha perseverancia y determinaci√≥n".
Desde el inicio de la invasi√≥n terrestre en Gaza el 27 de octubre, al menos 167 soldados israel√≠es han muerto, mientras que la cifra de militares -tanto activos como reservistas- fallecidos desde el ataque de Ham√°s del pasado 7 de octubre super√≥ este jueves los 500.
Todo ello, mientras los ataques y bombardeos de Israel siguieron causando en las √∫ltimas horas cientos de muertos palestinos, que son m√°s de 21.300 en los m√°s de dos meses y medio de ofensiva, a lo que se a√±ade una crisis humanitaria causada por el duro cerco israel√≠ sobre Gaza, que la ha dejado con gran escasez de alimentos, recursos esenciales, medicamentos, agua potable o gasolina para electricidad.
Continuar leyendo la historia Seg√∫n la agencia oficial de noticias Wafa, decenas de gazat√≠es murieron este jueves debido a bombardeos sobre viviendas en el sur de Gaza, √°rea donde se concentran gran parte de los 1,9 millones de desplazados internos en el enclave.
En la urbe de Rafah, punto m√°s meridional del enclave, "al menos 20 ciudadanos murieron y decenas resultaron heridos como resultado de un bombardeo israel√≠ que tuvo como objetivo una casa".
Los aviones de combate israel√≠es tambi√©n "lanzaron ataques contra una casa del campo de refugiados de Shaboura", en Rafah, que caus√≥ asimismo "decenas de fallecidos y heridos, la mayor√≠a mujeres y ni√±os", concret√≥ Wafa. Por otro lado, m√°s de 25 personas murieron en varios ataques sobre Jan Yunis, detall√≥ la misma fuente.
A su vez, entre otros incidentes, se inform√≥ de ataques en las localidades norte√±as de Beit Han√∫n o Beit Lahia, que incluyeron tambi√©n decenas de v√≠ctimas mortales, mientras las tropas israel√≠es siguen atacando el campo de refugiados de Al Maghazi, en la ciudad de Deir Balah, en el centro de Gaza, objeto de bombardeos casi constantes durante los √∫ltimos d√≠as.
Los servicios m√©dicos de la Media Luna Roja palestina informaron que sus equipos trasladaron al hospital a tres muertos y seis heridos por ataques contra una casa en el campo de Al Maghazi.
Sus equipos m√©dicos tambi√©n trabajan ahora con la Media Luna Roja de Egipto para crear un campamento para desplazados en la zona de Jan Yunis, que se espera que alcance las 1.000 tiendas de campa√±a.
Todo ello se produce mientras Israel tiene que ir planeando sus actuaciones a medio plazo en Gaza, y un plan para la posguerra que por ahora no parece estar determinado, lo que genera preocupaci√≥n a su principal aliado, Estados Unidos.
Justo este jueves, el secretario de Defensa estadounidense, Lloyd Austin, habl√≥ con Gallant y discuti√≥ aspectos de "los preparativos para la fase de estabilizaci√≥n que debe seguir a las operaciones de combate", inform√≥ el Pent√°gono.
La Casa Blanca estar√≠a presionando a Israel para que reduzca la intensidad de los ataques en Gaza, aunque Gallant dijo hace poco que estos se podr√≠an prolongar todav√≠a durante varios meses m√°s.
Por otro lado, seg√∫n prensa israel√≠, el primer ministro israel√≠, Benjam√≠n Netanyahu, deb√≠a celebrar este jueves una reuni√≥n de su Gabinete de Guerra para abordar posibles planes para la posguerra en Gaza, pese a que finalmente cancel√≥ el encuentro, mientras el Gobierno israel√≠ sigue sin dar detalles claros sobre qui√©n pretende que tenga el poder en Gaza o c√≥mo deber√≠a gestionarse su reconstrucci√≥n.
Seg√∫n medios israel√≠es, Netanyahu no quiso realizar encuentros para abordar esta cuesti√≥n hasta ahora, lo que preocupa a la Administraci√≥n Biden, que teme que el Ej√©rcito israel√≠ se quede estancado dentro del enclave indefinidamente.
(c) Agencia EFE
M√ÅS POPULARES La fiesta de celebridades "casi desnudas" que provoc√≥ un esc√°ndalo pol√≠tico en Rusia BBC News Mundo ¬∑ 4 min de lectura Las espeluznantes predicciones de Baba Vanga para el 2024 LA NACION ¬∑ 3 min de lectura El pez invasor de 200 kilos que se alimenta de pira√±as y avanza implacable por la Amazon√≠a BBC News Mundo ¬∑ 5 min de lectura Maduro volvi√≥ a arremeter contra Milei, lo tild√≥ de ‚Äúpitiyanqui y progringo‚Äù e hizo una advertencia LA NACION ¬∑ 2 min de lectura Loret responde a AMLO tras vincularlo con empresas de medicinas El Universal ¬∑ 1 min de lectura

author: Donna John
title: Quick Teriyaki Beef Bowls Recipe: A Chef's 20-Minute Ground Beef Asian Dinner
text:
Quick Teriyaki Beef Bowls Recipe: A Chef's 20-Minute Ground Beef Asian Dinner by Donna John
[Asian Recipes](/food/category/asian-recipes/) [Beef](/food/category/beef/) [Dinner](/food/category/dinner/) [Lunch](/food/category/lunch/) [Cookbooks](/food/category/cookbooks/) [Like
Like tip
You liked
](/food/tip/65220/like) [Comments
Add comment
](#comments) [Collections
Add to collection
In collection
]()
My favorite cookbook from all the ones I've received and bought last year is RecipeTin Eats Dinner by Magi Maehashi. My plan is to cook my way through it this year (new year's resolution?). On page 63 there is a fantastic recipe for
teriyaki beef bowls that is not just quick and easy, but full of Asian flavors. This ground beef recipe will be on repeat for dinner!
To make this
Asian dinner you will need just a few simple ingredients. Here is your shopping list: vegetable oil, garlic, onion, carrot, zucchini, ground beef, soy sauce, mirin, cooking sake and granulated sugar. Ground beef and a few vegetables (the kids won't even know they're there) are cooked then coated in a simple four-ingredient homemade teriyaki sauce. Delicious!
Serve this tasty teriyaki ground beef over rice or Chinese noodles. This recipe is so quick and easy that you may have time to whip up some
crispy eggrolls or crab rangoon to serve alongside it.
Here are a few more recipes from the cookbook:
Magic Baked Rice(our most popular recipe of 2023) Crazy Crispy No-Oil Chicken Baked Fish Recipe With Lemon Cream Sauce
Note: 30Seconds is a participant in the Amazon affiliate advertising program and this post contains affiliate links, which means we may earn a commission or fees if you make a purchase via those links.
Cuisine: Asian
Prep Time: 8 minutes
Cook Time: 12 minutes
Total Time: 20 minutes
Servings: 4
Ingredients
- 1 tablespoon
vegetable oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced fine
- 1 yellow onion, finely chopped
- 1 carrot, peeled and grated
- 1 zucchini, grated
- 1 pound ground beef
Teriyaki Sauce
- 3 tablespoons
soy sauce
- 3 tablespoons
mirin
- 3 tablespoons cooking sake (see Recipe Notes)
- 1/2 teaspoon
granulated sugar
Helpful Products
RecipeTin Eats Dinner Sesame Seeds Cutting Board Chef Knife Measuring Spoons Skillet Grater Garlic Press Box Grater Chopsticks
Recipe Notes
- Cooking sake can be found on the beer and wine aisle at your grocery store or in Asian markets.
- Try this recipe with ground turkey or ground chicken.
- I used low-sodium soy sauce.
- Magi garnishes the dish with sesame seeds. Read about the
health benefits of sesame seeds!
Here's how to make it:
- Mix all the teriyaki sauce ingredients together in a bowl. Set aside.
- Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the garlic and onion and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Add the carrot and zucchini and cook for another 3 minutes, or until any water in the vegetables evaporates.
- Add the ground beef and cook, breaking it up with a spoon, until browned.
- Add the teriyaki sauce and cook for about 4 minutes or until sauce evaporates into the meat and the meat is a little caramelized.
- Serve the beef over rice or noodles.
Nutrition Facts Per Serving
Calories: 134
Total Fat: 5.1g
Saturated Fat: 1.3g
Cholesterol: 22mg
Sodium: 265mg
Total Carbohydrate: 12.6g
Dietary Fiber: 1.5g
Total Sugars: 6.8g
Protein: 9g
Vitamin D: 0mcg
Calcium: 21mg
Iron: 5mg
Potassium: 290mg

author: Nick Schwartz
title: NFL predictions: Week 17 NFL picks against the spread
text:
The Broncos made a major move following a brutal home loss to the Patriots, benching star QB Russell Wilson in favor of Jarett Stidham. The former Auburn QB has only made two previous starts in 2022 for the Raiders, and went 0-2.
Stidham and the Broncos are still favored at home on Sunday ( -3.5 on bet365 ) against the Chargers, who have lost three consecutive games. The Broncos beat Los Angeles 24-7 on the road on December 10th.
Elsewhere in the NFL, the struggling Chiefs will have a chance at home to score a key win ( -7 vs. Cincinnati ), the surging Browns ( -7.5 vs. the Jets ) host Thursday Night Football, and the Lions and Cowboys clash on Saturday night ( Dallas -5.5 vs. Detroit ) will play a must-watch triple-header on Christmas Day.

author: Spc. Devin Davis
title: Provincial Government of Batanes hosts dedication ceremony for disaster relief warehouse with 130th Engineer Brigade [Image 7 of 19]
text:
U.S. Army engineers with the 523rd Engineer Support Company, 84th Engineer Battalion, 130th Engineer Brigade, 8th Theater Sustainment Command, conduct a dedication ceremony for a disaster relief warehouse they built with the Armed Forces of the Philippines, 513th Engineer Construction Battalion, 51st Engineer Brigade, who were also in attendance in Itbayat, Philippines, June 17, 2024. Salaknib is an annual exercise between the Armed Forces of the Philippines and the U.S. military designed to strengthen bilateral interoperability, capabilities, trust, and cooperation built over decades of shared experiences. (U.S. Army photo by Spc. Devin Davis)
